text.__SUMMARY__: Ondina divisa is a species of sea snail, a marine gastropod mollusk in the family Pyramidellidae, the pyrams and their allies.
text.Description: The length of the shell measures 3 mm.
text.Distribution:
This species occurs in the following locations:
European waters (Iceland and from Norway to the Bay of Biscay)
Belgian Exclusive Economic Zone
British Isles
Irish Exclusive economic Zone
Mediterranean Sea
text.References: van Aartsen J. J., 1987 : European Pyramidellidae: III. Odostomia and Ondina, Bollettino Malacologico 23 (1-4): 1-34
